questions.question_text: A technician needs maximum power redundancy while configuring a new server rack. Which of the following should be specified? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: The answers are AB check out this link https://aws.amazon.com/compare/the-difference-between-incremental-differential-and-other-backups/#:~:text=A%20differential%20backup%20strategy%20only,changes%20since%20the%20last%20backup.

Selected Answer: AB
An incremental backup is a backup of changes since a specified marker (usually a
full backup) and resets the archive bit. Backups are quicker than differentials, but
the restoral process is slower (must use each backup job after the full).

This means we want differential and synthetic full

Selected Answer: BE
Incremental: This method backs up only the changes since the last backup, which minimizes the amount of backup media required and can be performed quickly.
Synthetic full: This method creates a full backup by combining the last full backup with the changes since the last backup, which minimizes the amount of backup media required and provides a quick restore.

Selected Answer: BE
I am going with B&E

Differential: Takes less space than full backups, Faster restoration than incremental backups
Synthetic full
Full: Quick restore time, take up large amounts of unnecessary storage space
Incremental: Time-consuming restoration since data must be pieced together from multiple backups

https://www.unitrends.com/blog/types-of-backup-full-incremental-differential
https://gomindsight.com/insights/blog/four-data-backup-methods-it-resiliency/

Key word 'but minimize the amount of backup media required"
So It Incremental and synthetic

I'd go with provided answers. 

Full Slow backup, fast restore

Full+Incremental Fast backup, slow restore (compared to 
 Full+Differential)

Full+Differential Slow backup, fast restore (compared to 
 Full+Incremental)

Reference: The Official CompTIA Server+ Study Guide (Exam SK0-005)

comments.content: Differential (and Incremental) would actually *increase* the amount of tapes needed in the event of a restore, because you'd have to restore the most recent Full backup as well as the most recent Differential (or in the case of Incrementals, all incrementals since the most recent Full)

E - Incremental would increase the amount of media and take longer time to restore. Faster backup time. 
A - Differential would decrease the amount of media and take shorter time to restore. Longer backup time.
B - Synthetic Full - fast restore
Synthetic Full/Differential meets managements requirements.

discussion.content: B is quickest and E would take the least amount of time

questions.question_text: A technician needs to set up a server backup method for some systems. The company's management team wants to have quick restores but minimize the amount of backup media required. Which of the following are the BEST backup methods to use to support the management's priorities? (Choose two.)

A newly hired systems administrator is concerned about fileshare access at the company. The administrator turns on DLP for the fileshare and lets it propagate for a week. Which of the following can the administrator perform now?

choices.D: Manage the permissions from the fileshare.
choices.C: Audit the access to the physical fileshare.
choices.A: Manage the fileshare from an RDP session.
choices.B: Audit the permissions of the fileshare.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
DLP is Data Loss Prevention, aka digital monitoring. It has nothing to do with the Physical access to the Physical Fileshare. By using DLP to log which users have access to the fileshare, the sysadmin can now audit the permissions of those users.

Selected Answer: C
They could audit permissions before DLP after the can audit access
